definitions.definition: Pertaining to addition ; that can be, or has been, added .

examples: Matrix multiplication is additive , in that M v → + M w → = M ( v → + w → ) {\displaystyle M{\vec {v}}+M{\vec {w}}=M({\vec {v}}+{\vec {w}})} .

definitions.definition: Whose operator is identified as addition .
examples: It is natural to look at a finite cyclic group as an additive group.
definitions.label_groups: group theory , of a group, semigroup, etc.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to genes (or the interaction etc. of such genes) which govern the same trait and whose effects work together on the phenotype .

main_definition: ( mathematics ) Pertaining to addition ; that can be, or has been, added .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics , of a function , etc. ) That is distributive over addition .
( group theory , of a group, semigroup, etc. ) Whose operator is identified as addition .
( genetics ) Of or pertaining to genes (or the interaction etc. of such genes) which govern the same trait and whose effects work together on the phenotype .
